subject: Design
title: Rachel Carson: The Book That Started It All
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Rachel Carson: The Book That Started It All.

hook.text: In 1962, a marine biologist wrote a book about pesticides. It launched the entire environmental movement.

buildup.text: Rachel Carson's 'Silent Spring' documented how DDT was killing birds, fish, and contaminating food chains.

discovery.text: Carson showed that chemical products designed without ecological thinking cause cascading environmental damage.

twist.text: The chemical industry spent millions attacking Carson personally. She was dying of cancer during the fight.

climax.text: DDT was banned. The EPA was created. One book forced an entire industry to redesign its products.

punchline.text: One biologist's courage launched the entire environmental movement.

quiz.question: What did Rachel Carson's 'Silent Spring' lead to?
options: The DDT ban and creation of the Environmental Protection Agency
